titleStmt.title: Souls of the dying float
a hand-written transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: Draft lines for "Fancies at Navesink," first published in The Nineteenth Century (August 1885. The verso of contains draft and trial lines for "Of That Blithe Throat of Thine," first published in Harper's Monthly Magazine (January 1885).

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Fancies at Navesink
bibl.orgName: The Thomas Biggs Harned Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
The verso includes drafted content from "Of That Blithe Throat of Thine."

lg.l: F Souls of the dying float out with you
‸Chilren and m maidens and wive Strong men, fighters from battle, wearied,
Rocked in the twilight, ‸nowoutO wearied calms thy sleep

H late Lapp'd in the wa waters of
night and outnow y the ebbing tide

Born to thethat ocean, the hidden
measureles ‸shoreless, ‸soundless measureless—? Ocean with —eternal,
room for all.—shoreless, measureless ocean,
Ripples of river and waves of sea
